intro: Discospermum biloculare, commonly known as the two-celled discospermum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by animals. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
